subject: Re: [junit] Re: splitting this list
msgSnippet: I signed up for this list - after finding it in a web search - a couple of days ago.  I had no idea I d receive a FAQ after signing up.  Therefore, if I d had
messageBody:
I signed up for this list - after finding it in a web search - a
couple of days ago. I had no idea I'd receive a FAQ after signing
up. Therefore, if I'd had a question to ask at that time, I probably
would've asked it without thinking about it. If I weren't familiar
with Yahoo! Groups, I probably wouldn't have thought to check the
message archives beforehand, either. I'm glad it happened to work
out that I didn't end up being one of the people this thread is
about! What a welcome it would've been!

Thanks for providing the list, anyway, 'cause it looks interesting so
far.

-- LeAnne


On Sep 21, 2005, at 5:00 PM, Simon Chappell wrote:

> I can tell you that when I switched to using my gmail address for this
> mailing list (after deciding to discontinue using my employers email
> address for mailing lists), that I *did* receive a copy of the FAQ.
>
> Simon
>
> --
> www.simonpeter.com
>
>
> On 9/21/05, miked <mike@...> wrote:
>
>> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bradley, Todd" <todd.bradley@p...>
>>
>> <snip>
>>
>>
>>> Mike wrote:
>>>
>>>> As a newbie user/lurker myself I don't recall reading the
>>>> FAQ, but have made a note to look it up now...
>>>>
>>>
>>> Just today I unsubscribed and then resubscribed,
>>> to confirm that the FAQ is automatically emailed
>>> to new members. I wonder if the auto mailer
>>> doesn't work for everyone.
>>>
>>
>> I'm sure I got it, but as with all initial signup confirmation emails
>> getting thru the signup process and onto the list was the focus at
>> the
>> moment and I'm sure I just glanced at the FAQ. I can't be the only
>> one that does thi
>>
>> Perhaps adding a link to it part of the standard email footer would
>> help keep it visible. http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm
>>
>>
